textos_fuente.text: About Home Business Directory Contact Events Activities About Us Explore our County JOIN CONTACT Home Business Directory Events Explore Our County About Us Contact JOIN Why Join Dixie County Chamber of Commerce? About us Dixie Chamber of Commerce is a dedicated group of local businesses and individuals, along with a few businesses from outside our borders that are engaged in commerce or offering services in Dixie County. Together, we strive to support and promote businesses within our community, with a focus on advancing local commerce and fostering team building and leadership development through collaborative local projects. We convene every second Thursday of the month at noon to synchronize membership activities. We extend invitations to guest speakers who can offer valuable insights or seek our support for significant community improvement projects. Members share updates on their committee work and highlight opportunities for promoting their individual businesses through participation in specific activities or projects. Our diverse membership includes young entrepreneurs and seasoned business leaders, fostering a wealth of experience and perspectives. We've found that the best practices are often shared when members collaborate on events such as business expos, festivals, airport fly-ins, or broader economic development initiatives. By joining forces with other community groups, members have the opportunity to learn and share skills while also having fun, bringing impactful ideas to life. We actively support various youth-centered activities, including scholarships, livestock fairs, and initiatives to combat tobacco use. The current Membership Form is available on our website or by calling 352-498-5572. We hope that you will consider joining us in our efforts to promote commerce and enhance our community, ensuring that Dixie County remains a wonderful place to live, work, and play. Join Board of Directors Every member of our board of directors is a thought leader who has made significant contributions to our society. Officers Melanie Anderson Vice-President Debbie Deweese President Christy Roberts Secretary Debbie Dembo Treasurer Tina Keen Director Sheila Frierson Director Beverly Pivacek Director Debbie Deweese Director John Cherry Director Rebecca Fusco Director Debbie Dembo Director Cindy Bellot Director Melanie Anderson Director Andrew Rains Director Jason Banks Director Anne Hodges Director Steve Smith Director Dr. Linda Stoddard Director Barbie Higginbotham Director Christy Roberts Director ﻿ Home Business Directory About Us Contact CONTACT PO BOX 547 ﻿ Cross City, FL 32628 ( 352) 498-5572 info@dixiechamber.org JOIN Share by:

They are assigned to help guide, equip, and empower the pastors and staff at Journey Church to fulfill the mission and vision that God has uniquely given us. Our current Leadership Board members: Megan O’Connell, Jon Burgi, Lacey McNay, Ed Hatch, Amy Schlapper, Josh Thoreson. Get in Touch | Contact | Cornwall and Area Chamber of Commerce Looking to pay your invoice? Click here > About Events News Resources Sponsorship Partners Ribbon Cuttings Chambers Plan HR Covered Directory Contact Log out Become a Member > Become A Member Have a question or just want to say Hello? Feel free to reach out to us! You can contact us by phone, email or the contact form. We are available and happy to help you! Our business hours are 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, Monday to Thursday; Closed on Friday's. We're here to help! Simply fill in the form below, and we'll respond within 1-2 business days! Inquiring about... Membership Events Grants & Financial Support Advertising Sponsorships Other Thank you! Your submission has been received! Something went wrong. Please try again. Here's where you can reach us 16 Second Street West, Cornwall, ON K6J 1G2 (613) 933-4004 info@cornwallchamber.com FREQUENTLY Asked Questions How much does a membership cost? The price ranges depending on your business type and the number of employees you have. For a full breakdown, visit our Become a Member page for more details! How can I join? Visit our Become a Member page and sign up at the bottom of the page. We'd love to have you join! How do I pay an invoice? Payment can be made via EFT, cheque, or e-transfer to bero@cornwallchamber.com. Click here for more information. How is the Chamber funded? We are a Non-Profit Organization run by Volunteer Board Members, with our funding coming from Events, Membership Fees, and Sponsorship Revenue. We are not government funded. Why should I become a member? The Cornwall and Area Chamber of Commerce is the voice for our local businesses. We advocate for our members, provide new opportunities, and connect you with the community! Learn more about how we support you here > What are the member benefits? Members can access exclusive offers like discounted insurance policies and shipping, group medical plans, grant opportunities, and more. We also give your business opportunities to grow with our member directory, newsletters, sponsorships, and more! Learn about all the details here > How do I register for the benefits? Some benefits require a code you'll receive once you sign up, and others will automatically apply for being a Chamber member. What is Pub Night? When is the next one? Pub Nights are a monthly networking event hosted by the Cornwall and Area Chamber of Commerce. Each Pub Night is held at a different business (i.e. Schnitzels, Boston Pizza, etc.) Check out our Events page to see when the next Pub Night takes place! Where can I find Government Grants? Government Grants will be posted here on our website and sent to your inbox through our Chamber Newsletters as they become available. Join the Cornwall & Area Chamber of commerce Benefit from all the resources available to help your business thrive, join us at networking events, and more. Become a member Exclusive Discounts Group Medical Plans Chamber Newsletters Sponsorship Opportunities Member Events Exclusive Discounts Group Medical Plans Chamber Newsletters Sponsorship Opportunities Member Events Exclusive Discounts Group Medical Plans Chamber Newsletters Sponsorship Opportunities Member Events 16 Second St W, Cornwall, ON K6J 1G2 (613) 933 - 4004 info@cornwallchamber.com Find what you're looking for: Home About *NEW* Billboard Events & Sponsorships Contact Become a Member Member Directory News Careers Partners Pivot Points FAQ Grants & Financial Support Chamber Members View Account Sign Up Log In Reset Password Purchase a Membership Pay An Invoice Â© All rights reserved by the Cornwall and Area Chamber of Commerce

We collectively advocate for the businesses within our community, with the goal of furthering local commerce and team building and leadership development by working on local projects. With a strong community in place, anything is possible. Learn More Champaign County Business Empowered PAC The Champaign County Business Empowered Political Action Committee (PAC), a subsidiary corporation of the Chamber, endorses and supports business-friendly candidates for state and local office. Learn More iRead • iCount iRead • iCount is a literacy and math program to close achievement gaps. We need your help to be part of the solution to overcome these issues. This initiative will tremendously impact the lives of the students served and the community as a whole. As the voice of the business community, the Chamber helps to shape the business climate in Champaign County. Judge Dan Ison County Judge Executive Shelby County Fiscal Court 419 Washington Street Shelbyville, KYÂ  40065 633-1220 http://www.shelbycounty.ky.gov Dan lson has deep Kentucky roots as the son of a WWII veteran and a pioneering female police officer. Raised by his grandparents in Louisville's south end, he developed an early interest in civic affairs. After graduating from Butler High School, he worked as a photographer at Kentucky thoroughbred racetracks before enlisting in the Air Force at 19, serving in Vietnam. Following his military service, Dan climbed the ranks at Philip Morris in Louisville, eventually becoming Director of Community Relations. He furthered his education at Bellarmine University and Virginia Commonwealth University before retiring and consulting for Guthrie-Mayes Public Relations. As an entrepreneur, he ran a government relations firm, serving clients like Diageo and Philip Morris. Dan is actively involved in community efforts, holding leadership positions with the Simpsonville Volunteer Fire Department, Operation Brightside, and the Kentucky Derby Festival. He is a dedicated husband to real estate leader Debbie Holloway and a proud father and grandfather, enjoying farm life, reading, and time with his horses in his spare time.
